name: Lateral Lunge
setup: Stand with feet together, hands at chest or holding light dumbbell
Chest up, shoulders back, core braced
steps: Step wide to one side (2-3 feet)
Shift hips back and bend stepping leg while keeping other leg straight
Lower into lateral lunge, keeping chest up and weight on heel
Push through heel of bent leg to return to start
Repeat on same side or alternate legs
cues: Push hips back like an RDL
Weight on heel of bent leg
Full hip shift to working side
mistakes: Knee collapsing inward on bent leg
Rounding spine or dropping chest forward
Weight shifting to toes instead of heel
Not shifting hips laterally (staying too upright)
safety: If hips or knees feel cranky, reduce depth or step width. Keep torso upright and avoid excessive forward lean.

regressions: Assisted lateral lunge (hold TRX or rail)
progressions: Dumbbell or kettlebell lateral lunge (goblet hold)

prescriptionHints.notes: Great for hip mobility and glute activation. Start with bodyweight to master the pattern.

joints.notes: Ensure knee tracks over toes on bent leg. Keep spine neutral and avoid excessive forward lean.
